title: Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of 1972) and for the purpose of giving further
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These amending regulations are required to address issues consequential to the 
transfer of the function of competent authority for the implementation of the 
Marine Strategy Framework Directive (Directive 2008/56/EC) - as transposed 
by the European Communities (Marine Strategy Framework) Regulations 2011 
(S.I. No. 249) of 2011 (as amended) - from the Minister for Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage to the Minister for Climate, Energy and Environment. 

The regulations provide that all references to the “Minister for Communications, 
Energy and the Environment” in the S.I. No. 249 of 2011 are replaced by 
references to the “Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage”. 

This substitution: 

(a) 

(b) 

avoids a potential issue whereby the Minister for Climate, Energy 
and the Environment might be required to consult himself or 
herself, and 

ensures that, the Minister for Housing, Local Government and 
Heritage has an appropriate role and obligations under S.I. 249 of
text_norm: explanatory note (this note part instrument purport legal interpretation.) amending regulation required address issue consequential transfer function competent authority implementation marine strategy framework directive (directive 2008 56 ec) - transposed european community (marine strategy framework) regulation 2011 (s.i no 249) 2011 (as amended) - minister housing local government heritage minister climate energy environment regulation provide reference minister communication energy environment s.i no 249 2011 replaced reference minister housing local government heritage  substitution (a) (b) avoids potential issue whereby minister climate energy environment might required consult ensures minister housing local government heritage appropriate role obligation s.i 249
